qas.question: When did drug traffickers begin to use Guinea-Bissau?
Where did the drug traffickers come from?
What was the final destination of the drugs going through Guinea-Bissau?
Who described Guinea-Bissau as being at risk for becoming a "narco-state"?
Who has done little to stop drug trafficking in the country?

context: Beginning around <a0_0>2005<a0_0/>, drug traffickers based in <a1_0>Latin America<a1_0/> began to use Guinea-Bissau, along with several neighboring West African nations, as a transshipment point to <a2_0>Europe<a2_0/> for cocaine. The nation was described by <a3_0>a United Nations official<a3_0/> as being at risk for becoming a "narco-state". <a4_0>The government and the military<a4_0/> have done little to stop drug trafficking, which increased after the 2012 coup d'état.
